msContents.summary: Fragment of an Abbasid Qur'ān probably written in the third or fourth century A.H. / ninth or tenth century C.E, containing verses 50-75 from Sura al-Anfāl (سورة الأنفال)and verses 1-93 from Sura al-Tawba (سورة التوبة). Folios 1, 2 and 6 are wanting. The script seems to correspond to the Abbasid Style D common as described by F. Deroche.

msItem.title: al-Tawba - One hundred and thirty verses (التوبة مائة وثلاثون آية) [line 1]
التوبة مائة وثلاثون آية

handNote.p: The script seems to correspond to the Abbasid Style D common as described by F. Deroche.

origin.origDate: Probably 9th or 10th century CE /3rd or 4th century AH

history.provenance: Bought from Professor E.H. Palmer Palmer, Edward Henry, 1840-1882 and E.E. Tyrwhitt Drake Tyrwhitt Drake, E.E. in 1878.

recordHist.source: This manuscript description was created by Ignacio Sanchez at the Middle Eastern Department of Cambridge University Library. For the Paleaographic classification refer to Déroche, 1992.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions. Contact near_eastern@lib.cam.ac.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript

monogr.title: A hand-list of the Muḥammadan manuscripts: including all those written in the Arabic character, preserved in the library of the University of Cambridge
The Abbasid tradition: Qurʼans of the 8th to the 10th centuries AD

imprint.publisher: The Nour Foundation in association with Azimuth Editions and Oxford University Press

series.title: The Nasser D. Khalili Collection of Islamic Art
